intro: Thalictrum simplex proles alpicola, commonly known as the alpine meadow rue, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. It is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, temperate climates and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
